question: Which institution has held that state Governments can make laws for providing reservation to sub-castes within SC and ST categories?
option4: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
explanation:
The apex judicial body, Supreme Court of India has held that state Governments may make legislations for providing reservation to sub-castes within Scheduled Castes (SC) and Scheduled Tribe (ST) categories.
The judgment was pronounced by the Constitution bench of Justices - Arun Mishra, Indira Banerjee, Vineet Saran, MR Shah and Aniruddha Bose. But the bench has referred the matter to Chief Justice of India to send it for consideration by a larger bench.
